activities.loc: MDB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

chargeHist.descr: Cause Child 13-18 to View Sex. Activity

result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody A Benson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Cause Child 13-18 to View Sex. Activity, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.055(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to the probation office within 48 hours.

miscConds.notes: Must have no contact with E.W. DOB 9/14/2004.

Must comply with sex offender evaluation. 
Issue of sex offender registration is held open. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. 
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately, to submit DNA sample.

Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt. Attorney Fees To Be Determined.

timeConds.notes: Court grants 2 days credit if revoked from probation.

Agreement put on the record.

Count #1:  Defendant pleads guilty; Court finds factual basis to accept plea and finds defendant guilty of same.
Count #2:  State moves to dismiss and read-in; Court grants motion.

05/24/2022 THIS BOND IS AMENDED TO REMOVE THE CONDITION OF "MUST HAVE NO CONTACT WITH CUMBERLAND KWIK TRIP EXCEPT FOR EMPLOYMENT RELATED PURPOSES'.  ALL OTHER CONDITIONS OF PREVIOUS BOND TO REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

Attorney Longacre moves to modify bond to remove the condition of "no contact with Cumberland Kwik Trip except for work related purposes."  Condition of "no contact with E.W. d.o.b. 9/14/2004" to continue.  All other conditions of previous bond to remain in full force and effect.  Court grants bond modification.
Must sign amended bond by close of business today; 5/24/2022.

01:45 PM Defendant Cody A Benson in court by Zoom video with attorney Andrew T Knaak by Zoom video for today only.  Defendant Cody A Benson in custody.  Brian H. Wright appeared for the State of Wisconsin in court.
Defendant must call the public defenders office immediately after today's hearing to determine eligibility.
